description.narrative: The project aims to identified and test successful and innovative solutions, with scaling-up potential.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level. 1.2 Diversity of different data sources used (number) 1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented 1.4 Number of Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses. 2.1 Number of Learning activities the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public audience (outside of UNDP) 2.2 Proportion of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners 2.3 Number of g partners that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite 2.4 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies (learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects). 3.1 Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs (number of interactions with another lab) 3.2 Proportion of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network. 3.3 Number and type of Engagement of the broader Development ecosystem with published learnings from the Accelerator Lab Network. 3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem.

comment.narrative:
1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level: 5 1.2 Diversity of different data sources used (number): 6 1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented: 35 1.4 Number of Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses: 6 2.1: At least 6 blogs or other (substantial) media posts published 2.2: At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart 2.3:At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method
2.4: At least 50% 3.1:at least once a week ( 48 Interaction per Year) 3.2:25% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3: (The Accelerator Lab Networks work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts). The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account. 3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem.

1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level: 5 1.2 Diversity of different data sources used (number): 5 1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented: 12 (Canaleta recolectora de agua lluvia; Refrigerador Pila; Muro rompeolas; Obtención de agua por medio de pozo con bomba y pozo sin bomba; Construcción de pozos familiares (con y sin bomba); Almacenaje de agua en recipientes reutilizados; Uso de pañuelo de tela como filtro; Chorros comunitarios.https://www.appropedia.org/Mapeo_de_agua_en_La_Libertad/El_Zonte Construcción de pozos familiares (con y sin bomba) Almacenaje de agua en recipientes reutilizados. Compra de agua a otras comunidades. Compra de agua a empresas distribuidoras de agua. Hervir el agua para consumo.) 1.4 Number of Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses: 13 (Design Thinking (Kit de Aceleración); Solutions Mapping (Perfilamiento Comunitario); Storytelling (Lanzamiento); Gamification (Kit); Data Visualization (Story Map); Proof of Concept (Digichiquihuites ISBM); Collective Intelligence (Corporate retreat; Viaje del Agua); Design Sprints (Reto de Aceleración, Kit); HCD (Reto+Kit); Micro Narratives (El viaje del Agua); Visual Thinking and Mapping (Story Map); Community Asset Mapping (Perfilamiento); Sensemaking (Portfolio H20). 2.1: At least 6 blogs or other (substantial) media posts published: 4 (Kit de Aceleración; Kit de Aceleración Digital; Perfilamiento en Appropedia; El viaje del Agua; Storymap) 2.2: At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart: 100% (Secretaría de Innovación, Comisión Presidencial del Agua, Ministerio de Turismo, Instituto Salvadoreño de Turismo, Instituto Salvadoreño de Bienestar Magisterial) 2.3: At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method: 3 (Ministerio de Turismo, Instituto Salvadoreño de Turismo, Instituto Salvadoreño de Bienestar Magisterial) 2.4: Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies (learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects). 50% 3.1: Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs (number of interactions with another lab) 52 times (at least 1 per week) 3.2: Proportion of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network. 90% of information shared across the network is methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3: Number and type of Engagement of the broader Development ecosystem with published learnings from the Accelerator Lab Network. 11.5 times per month (For a total of 139 Tweets using the Hashtag #RapidosyCuriosos) 3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem: 5 key accounts identified that are engaging with social media content the Lab is producing.
